•local vet’s in the last 3 years from £28 to £65. For app. 

•scan was £300 during surgery hours, is now £1000. 

•more animals are being put to sleep
•owners avoiding going
•vaccinations down, spread of diseases 
•Dogs and cats are not being neutered, more unwanted pups, kittens 

•we are being taken advantage of. 
•many companies who own Vets, seeing animals as a commodity

attributes.background: Vet bills are up by more than 60% between 2015 and 2023, risen by another 5-10% since then. Minimum cost for a vet visit is usually £300. Only the very wealthy can afford to take their pets to the vets. We need affordable vet care for all animals in every household, no matter their income.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could outline what measures you would like to be taken in relation to the affordability of veterinary care.

You may also wish to sign the following petitions:

Remove VAT from pet veterinarian bills
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/706056

Create a national pet health service for veterinary care
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/728285
